defs: to cause to have, possess or put on.
that which is kept from other's knowledge; the inner secret.
the innermost part of a temple, where the main idol is installed; the sanctum sanctorum.
the inner portion in a house; an inner apartment.
the mental pain, agony; torment or torture felt or being felt within; the state of suppressed anger, agony, anxiety or excitement.
to leak out a secret.
a hostile activity carried out secretly.
an inner jacket.
to be subject to another's control or jurisdiction.
to hand over to the control of another.
to bring under one's control or jurisdiction.
to cause to be under one's control.
to make a person a target for (blame, scolding, responsibility, etc.).
to bring or cause to come.
to lure a person to one's side.
to rush into; to enter forcibly.
to make known a secret; to disclose; to divulge; to reveal.
the inner apartment of a house.
on, to or towards the inside.
within one's mind; into the mind, thoughts or soul; inward.
at a time earlier to; before.
secretly.
below or within (a certain limit).

ಒಳಗೆ ಅಮ್ಮನ ಕಾಟ, ಹೊರಗೆ ಗುಮ್ಮನ ಕಾಟ oḷage ammana kāṭa, horage gummana kāṭa (children's dilemma) inside mamma puts on the mat, outside bogie bothers; ಒಳಗಿಕ್ಕು oḷagikku to keep inside, esp. from the sight or knowledge (of others); ಒಳಗುಗಿ oḷagugi to fear within; to have the feeling of anxiety or apprehension; ಒಳಗುರಿ oḷaguri to burn within or from within.
the central portion of a water tank.
household works; the work of a house-keeper.
internal management of affairs, as of a business.
a bad inner feeling as hatred, jealousy, envy (which are not noticed from outside); corruption of the mind.
= ಒಳಗೆರೆ.
to have; to possess.
to include; to contain; to consist of; to be composed of; to comprise.
to induce a person to do something secretly and illegally.
a man who gets secret information about another's affairs, plans, etc.; a spy.
to contain (within); to include within.
to acquire; to assume; to take on.
to happen; to occur; to befall; to come to pass.
to be included in or within; to be comprised of.
to put on (a clothes, a new form etc.) 6) to cover from all or almost all sides; to encircle; to surround.
to undergo successfully or patiently; to endure; to bear.
the inner part of a town or country, closer to or running along with the fort.
an inner room in a relatively huge building as a palace.
the beauty or charm that is not easily seen or understood.
an underground pipe or drain used to carry off water and waste matter; sewers.
the inner layer of the skin of humans or other animals.
the inner layer of cells of the embryo, from which is formed the lining of the digestive tract, of other internal organs, and of certain glands.
to stretch or grow (oneself) inward.
to push (something) inside.
a branch of a plant, limb of the body, etc. that has grown or stretched inward.
a room inside a house, where meetings are held.
the inner feelings, thoughts, process of thinking, etc. of the mind; the undisclosed thought or secret.
an indirect piercing or piercing from within that sharply affects the feelings.
= ಒಳಚಾವಡಿ.
intense competition or conflict, often bitterly personal, as between political opponents or within an organisation or group or among members of a house; in-fighting.
a raised platform (usu. a mortar, cement structure) within a house.
a toxin given out by the bacteria living inside the body; endotoxin.
a little pouch sewn inside the clothing (as a shirt, inner-jacket, etc.) for carrying money and small articles.
the condition of increased body temperature caused by infections, characteristics of which are not obviously recognised or felt; internal pyrexia.
the inner sole of a footwear.
a bending inward (like the inside of a bowl).
an undisclosed plan, scheme; a secret mission.
to turn in or about; to reverse; to invert.
the state of being turned inward; inversion.
inversion of the edge of the eye-lid; entropion.
= ಒಳದೆಗೆ.
an inland tax levied by a government on commercial goods.
= ಒಳಜಗಳ.

2) intense clash of different, but contradictory feelings within oneself; emotional disturbance resulting from a clash of opposing impulses or from one's inability to reconcile impulses with realistic or moral considerations.
a low, subdued voice.
conscience which governs the mind; a moral sense.
the inside of the gums; the side of the gums that is closer to the tongue.
a shorter way to get to the same place.
any way of saving time, effort, expense, etc.
a secret, surreptitious manner (esp. to get something done).
the direction toward the inside.
to push, thrust in (usu. using force).
to take in; to draw in (as in breathing).
= ಒಳನಾಡು.
the core part of stem of some plants as amaranth, etc.
= ಒಳತೋಟಿ.
a close, trustworthy relative.
a passing from one condition, form, stage, activity, etc. which is happening without being noticed in a short duration.
to impress or establish firmly, esp. on the mind; to imprint.
an impression established on the mind; an imprint.
the interior of a country or region; inland areas; inland.
a slender, threadlike structure as can be found in a few varieties of mango, a few vegetbles, etc.
the inner side of a fort, barrier etc.
the inner portion of a house.
conscience which governs the mind; a moral sense.

an internal reason (as opp. the one from external agent).
to fill in; to fill the inner portion.
insight - a) the ability to see and understand clearly the inner nature of things, esp. by intuition; b) a clear understanding of the inner nature of some specific thing.
a division of a group; a sub-group; a sub-sect.
a hold in which a part of the opponeṇṭs body is firmly gripped not allowing him or her to move.
a weight used to correct the difference between the two pans of a balance.
to include in or subject to the control of; to bring under the jurisdiction of.
to corrupt or spoil the morality of a person.
to be subject to; to be under the control of; to fall within the jurisdiction of.
to surrender; to accept one's defeat.
an inner layer or fold.
a thought, process of thought etc. of a person not made evident to another or others.
a person patrolling inside a (military) camp.

an underskirt often trimmed at the hemline as with lace or ruffles, worn by women and girls; a petticoat.
a summary of the subject-matter of a book (usu. a list of the titles of chapters etc. with corresponding page number); a list of contents; an index.
to cause to go in.

to enter in; to go or come in.
to be included in.
to examine thoroughly.
to win by sowing dissensions in enemy camp.
to include; to contain.
to cause to become favourably inclined; to win or regain the good will of.
to bring a person or a thing under one's control.
to take in; to consume.
to break into pieces; to separate; to sever.
the inner layer of the pericarp of a ripe ovary or fruit, as the pit surrounding the seed of a drupe; a layer or sheet which being inside covers an inner or innermost part.
a publicising secretly.
an area surrounded on its four sides by buildings; a quadrangle.
= ಒಳಪ್ರಾಂಗಣ.
the mind - a) that which thinks, perceives, feels, wills, etc.; seat or subject of consciousness; b) the thinking and perceiving part of consciousness; intellect or intelligence.
a shorter way to get to the same place.
any way of saving time, effort, expense, etc.
(fig.) the path of self-knowledge.
clothing worn under one's outer clothes, usually next to the skin, as undershirts, undershorts or slips; an underwear.
the inner side of anything.
an inner door.
to bend inward; to have a curvature inward as the inner surface of a bowl.
a bending inward (like the inside of a bowl).
the true way or manner one lives in (as opp. to the one as projected to others).

to be caught (by an enemy); to be under the control of (another).
to enclose (a place or a body of troops) on all sides; to surround; to encircle; to make an inroad.

(dial.) a marshy tract of land, covered with water, situated by the side of a mountain.
= ಒಳಬೆಳಗು.
the light inside a place.
(fig.) the knowledge of the Supreme; self-knowledge.
the feeling of love one has for another of opposite sex.
a secret treasury, esp. of a king.
that which is empty, hollow or worthless.
the quality of being worthless; hollowness.

the inner portion, region, of anything; inside; interior.
the inside of a wall or wall-like structure.
(bot.) the inner wall of a spore or pollen grain; intine; an endospore.
the inner side of anything.
intermediate space.

the inner chamber of a house; a room or inner apartment.
darkness within.
(fig.) spiritual ignorance.

the apparent perception of sights, sounds, etc. that are not actually present.
the mental disorder that causes the imaginary object apparently seen, heard, etc.
to get hallucination cured.
the inner secret.
(dial.) to come in; to arrive at.
a communication meant for private or limited circulation; a secret.
the inland commerce of a state.
an upper storey of house, that has entrance from within the house.
the inside, inner surface of anything.
an attitude in which one directs one's interest to one's own experiences and feelings rather than to external objects or other persons; introversion.

the inner surface of anything.
the mind that cannot be seen by others.

introversion - a) the state of being introverted; b) the state or tendency toward being wholly or predominantly concerned with and interested in one's own mental life.
a painful swelling of a vein in the region of the anus, that often bleeds; piles; haemorrhoids.
a secret, evil, project or scheme; conspiracy; a breaking faith with; betrayal.
to break faith with; to betray; to plan secretly in order to commit a crime.
on or to the inside.

a war between opposing groups of citizens of the same country; a civil war.

to cry out loudly and without restraint under strong impulse (as pain or grief).
the liquid part of a fruit or vegetable.
that which makes something what it is; intrinsic, fundamental nature or most important quality (of something); essential being.

any of vices considered to be the enemies in one's spiritual life (as lust, anger, avarice, delusion, conceit, jealousy, etc.).
